Key Match Events: Luis Severino pitched 7 sparkling innings in a 4-1 win over the Red Sox at Citi Field on Monday
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets' fifth consecutive victory moved New York within a half-game of the idle Braves for the final National League Wild Card spot
Post-Match Reflections: Luis Severino credited head trainer Joe Golia and nutritionist Jeremy Chiang for their roles in helping him stay strong and nimble
Severino said he has reported improved sleep habits since visiting a specialist last offseason
Manager Carlos Mendoza praised Severino's hard work and dedication saying 'Proud of him'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets plated runs on a Nimmo RBI double in the third inning and a Francisco Lindor run-scoring single in the fourth
Phil Maton recorded his first Mets save to cap the breezy victory
Others: Severino has not only overcome his injury history, heâ€™s demolished his reputation as an injury-prone pitcher
The Mets are 10 games over.500 for the first time since 2022
